snippet: On Thursday, after the three-hour onstage slugfest that is "Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf," some 40 therapists and their companions will stay in their seats at the Booth Theater for a short conversation with the play's director and cast.
abstract: On Thursday, after the three-hour onstage slugfest that is "Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf," some 40 therapists and their companions will stay in their seats at the Booth Theater for a short conversation with the play's director and cast.

headline.main: Couples Counseling for 'Virginia Woolf''s George and Martha
headline.print_headline: Hey, George and Martha, Help Is on the Way
